text.0: to indra dyaus the asura hath bowed him down to indra mighty earth with wideextending tracts to win the light with widespread tracts.
text.1: all gods of one accord have set indra in front preeminent.
text.2: for indra all libations must be set apart all mans libations set apart.
text.3: in all libations men with hero spirit urge the universal one each seeking several light each fain to win the light apart.
text.4: thee furthering like a ship will we set to the chariotpole of strength.
text.5: as men who win with sacrifices indras thought men who win indra with their lauds.
text.6: couples desirous of thine aid are storming thee pouring their presents forth to win a stall of kine pouring gifts indra seeking thee.
text.7: when two men seeking spoil or heaven thou bringest face to face in war.
text.8: thou showest indra then the bolt thy constant friend the bull that ever waits on thee.
text.9: this thine heroic power men of old time have known wherewith thou breakest down indra autumnal forts breakest them down with conquering might.
text.10: thou hast chastised o indra lord of strength the man who worships not.
text.11: and made thine own this great earth and these waterfloods with joyous heart these waterfloods.
text.12: and they have bruited far this heromight when thou o strong one in thy joy helpest thy suppliants who sought to win thee for their friend.
text.13: their battlecry thou madest sound victorious in the shocks of war.
text.14: one stream after another have they gained from thee eager for glory have they gained.
text.15: also this morn may he be well inclined to us mark at our call our offerings and our song of praise our call that we may win the light.
text.16: as thou o indra thunderarmed wilt as the strong one slay the foe.
text.17: listen thou to the prayer of me a later sage hear thou a later sages prayer.
text.18: o indra waxen strong and wellinclined to us thou very mighty slay the man that is our foe slay the man hero with thy bolt.
text.19: slay thou the man who injures us hear thou as readiest to hear.
text.20: far be malignity like mischief on the march afar be all malignity.
